you need to put that into a cname or txt record in your domain. So either on godaddy or whatever domain registration platform you used, in the domain settings, you will add that

that is correct, but it doesn't have to be. If your app is free then just put the installation url that you find in app itself for installation. If you have a paywall, then you use the link to paywall first

hey i need help . i have create an a app on HubSpot developer account and now i want to connect this app with my another account and also want to connect my workflow with my custom app .how is this possible
ok, you cannot move apps from one account to another as far as I am aware.
but you can have the users on multiple dev accounts
as for the workflow, you mean workflow actions?
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/private-apps#:~:text=You%20must%20be%20a%20super,create%20a%20public%20app%20instead>.
yes i am not able to install this app from my developer account to my another account
that's because private apps aren't real apps
they are only available on the local account
Agreed <@U03JDEHCX17>
i want to listing this app on marketplace and it show that you have three unique app installed
you need to create a real app <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/creating-an-apphttps://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/creating-an-app>
can you send a screenshot? of your app dashboard?
yes, you need to have 3 unique app installs. but that doesn't apply to private apps
ok that looks like a real call
hello can i create contacts or any other object like deals or workflow in HubSpot developer account
when i hit the install url of my app it gives me this kind of code but what is the next step to install the app
HubSpot developer accounts are just for building apps, you can build out workflows in sandbox accounts though
That's the oauth code for your app, use that code in conjunction with an oauth server like this one <https://github.com/HubSpot/oauth-quickstart-nodejs>
